product_name: La Roche-PosayLipikar AP+ Gentle Foaming Cleansing Oil
summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganDiscover La Roche-Posay's Lipikar AP+ Gentle Foaming Body & Face Cleansing Oil for dry to extra dry, sensitive skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsFoaming body & face cleansing oil provides long-lasting, 24 hour hydrationGently cleanses skin and helps alleviate drynessSkin feels instantly soothed and moisturizedSkin feels soft and suppleHelps protect skin from drying effects of waterHelps prevent loss of hydration over timeKey IngredientsLa Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water is naturally rich in minerals with scientifically demonstrated soothing and antioxidant propertiesShea Butter helps restore and sooth skinNiacinamide is form of vitamin B3 with soothing propertiesGlycerin moisturizes and hydrates the skinFeaturesDermatologist TestedSafe for Sensitive SkinParaben FreeFragrance FreeNon ComedogenicAllergy TestedSoap FreeSuitable for Babies 2 weeks and upSuitable for patients undergoing chemotherapy.**Do not use on broken skin. Consult a medical professional prior to use.Item 2611201How To UseStep 1: Wet skin with lukewarm water.Step 2: Lather in hands and apply to wet body and face.Step 3: Massage foaming body & face cleansing oil gently into skin to cleanse.Step 4: Rinse thoroughly and pat dry without rubbing.Can be used on face and body.IngredientsWater, Glycerin, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Peg-200 Hydrogenated Glyceryl Palmate, Coco-Betaine, Polysorbate 20, Citric Acid, Peg-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, Oniacinamide, Acrylates Copolymer, Butyrospermum Parkii Butter / Shea Butter, Cocamide Mea, Disodium Edta, Glycol Distearate - Mannose, Polyquaternium-11, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide - Vitreoscilla Ferment.
how_to_use: Step 1: Wet skin with lukewarm water.Step 2: Lather in hands and apply to wet body and face.Step 3: Massage foaming body & face cleansing oil gently into skin to cleanse.Step 4: Rinse thoroughly and pat dry without rubbing.Can be used on face and body.

reviews.headline: Great foaming cleanser
reviews.comments: It cleans thoroughly without a dry uncomfortable feeling afterwards.Also great as a body wash

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: This is surprisingly great face wash. For such an inexpensive product, it does a perfect job getting rid of all my makeup without over drying my skin

reviews.headline: Never buy again‚òπÔ∏èüò¢
reviews.comments: Its not working for my skin I was using inkey hylurunic acid cleanser but when I out of that cleanser I just buy this and It's make my skin dry and bad texture in one week it's make you skin dry and rough texture.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Received a sample of this and love it so much i just bought a full size. It gets my skin smoother than i even thought was possible! Not really sure if i am supposed to use this alone or as part of a double cleanse, it feels mostly like normal facewash.

reviews.headline: Almost ruined my skin barrier
reviews.comments: I used this for about a week and then I had to stop. I have dry skin so I figured I should try this instead of the normal bottle I get. The first day wasn't bad but the next day the skin on my face was so irritated and sensitive which isn't normal for me. I figured maybe my skin isn't used to it but then the next day my skin was SOOOO dry even after applying my moisturizer & sunscreen. Eventually the irritation got so painful I had to stop using it. as soon as I went back to the hydrating gentle cleanse my face went back to normal.

reviews.headline: Feeling a bit duped, not an oil cleanser
reviews.comments: Like the review title, this isn't a true oil cleanser. It feels more like a gel consistency. It does remove make up really well however it's not particularly hydrating, and as I wait for my face to dry, it does feel a bit tight and is certainly not hydrated, if a bit tight. Ill keep giving it a go just to see but I'll probably downgrade this to a body wash or see if my husband likes it.

reviews.headline: Excellent cleanser
reviews.comments: I have tried many cleansers that claim to remove makeup. This one really works! It is gentle on the skin and very effective.

reviews.headline: Not for me.
reviews.comments: Wanted to try this because I love their purifying foaming cleanser but this broke me out in little bumps and left my skin a strange texture. Also not a true oil cleanser and has a very strange texture.

reviews.headline: Gentle, Effective, and Perfect for Sensitive Skin
reviews.comments:
I can't say enough good things about La Roche-Posay's Foaming Cleansing Oil! From the first use, it made a noticeable difference in how my skin felt‚Äîclean, soft, and incredibly nourished without any tightness or irritation. Unlike many cleansers that strip moisture away, this formula gently lifts away impurities while actually strengthening the skin barrier.

The texture is luxurious‚Äîit foams just enough without feeling heavy or greasy, making it perfect for both morning and night routines. Plus, a little goes a long way, so the bottle lasts much longer than expected. It's enriched with soothing ingredients like niacinamide and shea butter, which leave the skin feeling calm and hydrated.

As someone with sensitive, dry-prone skin, finding a cleanser that truly cleans without causing redness or dryness has always been a challenge. This one checks every box. It's also fragrance-light, dermatologist-recommended, and safe for the whole family, which makes it even more impressive.

If you're looking for a cleanser that protects your skin's natural balance while giving you a fresh, clean feeling, I highly recommend La Roche-Posay Foaming Cleansing Oil. It's truly a game-changer!

reviews.headline: Irritation of Skin
reviews.comments: The first use I liked it,it felt really nice. but after that it made my skin really red, and it burned!! I wouldnt really consider my skin sensative either! This overall caused severe redness and burning unfortunatly!! And now the day after using it, my skin still burns when not using it, and when putting moisturizer on. Dont recommend if you have any sort of sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: Destroyed my skin barrier
reviews.comments: I ignored 1 star reviews saying it gave them a bad breakout. This DESTROYED my skin. I had the worst acne i have had in years and i dont get acne. I used this for a couple months chalking my acne up to stress. The day i stopped using it my skin immediately started to heal and go back to normal.

reviews.headline: dry skin loves this
reviews.comments: i got a mini sample size of this at my doctor's office, and i am not disappointed! i have dry, eczema prone skin, so it needs all the moisture it can get. this made my skin feel soft and it looked very hydrated after using without moisturizer.

reviews.headline: 10 out of 10 Recommend!!
reviews.comments: Okay friend, look. I was a little scared buying it too. But the Lord said to buy it and boom, skin CLEAR. I'm not even lying, a new cleanser was needed and this seems to be doing its job! Along with Good Molecules productsü´∂üèΩ

reviews.headline: you can skip this- not worth the hype
reviews.comments: this stuff was supposed to be better than Ceraves hydrating oil cleanser that they duped. it sucks i have to use two pumps for it to fully cover my face. when you add a little water it doesnt sud up, it washes away. it doesnt even sud up without water?? its terrible. dont waste your money

reviews.headline: Didn't work well on my dry skin
reviews.comments: A great cleanser but I dont understand why its targeted towards dry skin.. my skin felt extremely stripped using this product which led to a lot of flaking and breakouts. If you have really dry skin go for the hydrating gentle cleanser by la roche instead of this one.

reviews.headline: Everyone's skin reacts differently
reviews.comments: First everyone's skin reacts different to any product. Don't let a negative review keep you from trying something that might work for you. Form your own opinion. For my skin it works well and I love it... But try for yourself. And no it's not a double cleanse product. If you don't wear makeup you don't need a cleansing balm or oil. However on the days you do wear makeup Cliniques cleansing balm is perfect and then follow with this as the second cleanse

reviews.headline: I buy this product all the time
reviews.comments: I love this cleaning oil! It leaves my skin feeling clean and not dry!

reviews.headline: Horrible breakout
reviews.comments: I have dry skin, i used this cleanser for a month and broke out so bad. I have never had a product break me out so bad in my life. I stopped using and my pimples immediately started to heal

reviews.headline: Love it!!
reviews.comments: I love it. I used it for about two weeks everyday I didn't break out at all. I have sensitive skin. This wash makes my face feel smooth and hydrated. I will be buying this product again. Highly recommend.

reviews.headline: Makeup remover
reviews.comments: Love this cleanser. It removes my makeup so easily. It can be a little drying but I just make sure to moisturize after

media.headline: I'm still iffy about it
media.caption: This is right after washing my face with it

faceoff_positive.comments:
I recently tried La Roche Posay's Lipikar Oil, a fragrance-free gentle foaming cleansing oil. Having dry and sensitive skin, I was intrigued by the product's claims of being fragrance-free and suitable for both face and body. 

Firstly, I must say that the fragrance-free claim is 100% accurate. This is a significant advantage for individuals with sensitive skin or those who prefer products without added scents. I appreciated that the product didn't have any overpowering fragrance. I did a sniff test, as did my husband, and we smelled absolutely nothing.

Living in the dry heat of Vegas where temperatures often exceed 100 degrees, my skin tends to become dehydrated quickly. When using Lipikar Oil, I noticed that my skin felt more hydrated and nourished compared to some other cleansers I've tried. It effectively cleansed my skin without stripping away its natural moisture.

One of the standout features of Lipikar Oil is its versatility. Being suitable for both the face and body, it offers convenience and multi-purpose functionality. I used it solely on my body, but the fam used it for their entire body. I, personally, am not a huge fan of all-in-one cleansers and use products specifically for my face, but for my husband and kids, it's  incredibly convenient for their skincare routine. It saves time and space in my husband and kiddo's skincare routine, as they can use it in the shower for their entire body, including their face. The formula is gentle and didn't cause any irritation or dryness on my skin.

Overall, La Roche Posay's Lipikar Oil is a reliable and fragrance-free cleansing oil that caters well to dry and sensitive skin. Its ability to cleanse without drying and its versatility for use on both the face and body make it a convenient option. In the hot and dry conditions of Vegas, I appreciated its hydrating properties.

Lipikar Oil is accepted by the National Eczema Association, making it a good choice for those seeking a gentle and effective cleansing option for dry and/or sensitive skin.
faceoff_positive.headline: Fragrance free Hydration

faceoff_negative.comments: I have dry, sensitive skin and this did not work for my skin at all. It was not moisturizing making my skin dry, tight and red. Sad :(
faceoff_negative.headline: Drying and irritating

rollup.name: Lipikar AP+ Gentle Foaming Cleansing Oil
